If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with üëé to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -730,7 +730,7 @@ General Bitcoin Core
 
 - Make sure pull requests pass CI before merging.
 
-  - *Rationale*: Makes sure that they pass thorough testing, and that the tester will keep passing
+  - *Rationale*: Make sure that they pass through testing, and that the tester will keep passing

@@ -730,7 +730,7 @@ General Bitcoin Core
 
 - Make sure pull requests pass CI before merging.
 
-  - *Rationale*: Makes sure that they pass thorough testing, and that the tester will keep passing
+  - *Rationale*: Make sure that they pass through testing, and that the tester will keep passing
comments.body: yes. i guess it means pass all the testing cases. sorry for the inconvenience. i have reverted this change.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1415,7 +1415,7 @@ A few guidelines for introducing and reviewing new RPC interfaces:
     convert a plaintext command line to JSON. If the types don't match, the method can be unusable
     from there.
 
-- A RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
+- An RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
comments.body: Makes sense, although both "a" and "an" sound acceptable to me: https://www.utwente.nl/en/language-centre/translation-editing-services/english-styleguide/abbreviations/ (see "INDEFINITE ARTICLE ‚ÄòA‚Äô OR ‚ÄòAN‚Äô BEFORE ACRONYMS")

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1415,7 +1415,7 @@ A few guidelines for introducing and reviewing new RPC interfaces:
     convert a plaintext command line to JSON. If the types don't match, the method can be unusable
     from there.
 
-- A RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
+- An RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not

@@ -1415,7 +1415,7 @@ A few guidelines for introducing and reviewing new RPC interfaces:
     convert a plaintext command line to JSON. If the types don't match, the method can be unusable
     from there.
 
-- A RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
+- An RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
comments.body: I looked this up also but have no strong opinion. It could also be read "a remote procedure call" which would make the original correct

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1415,7 +1415,7 @@ A few guidelines for introducing and reviewing new RPC interfaces:
     convert a plaintext command line to JSON. If the types don't match, the method can be unusable
     from there.
 
-- A RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
+- An RPC method must either be a wallet method or a non-wallet method. Do not
comments.body: @pinheadmz no, a/an always refers to the "RPC" acronym, not to its meaning. It only depends on how you pronounce the letters R P C, and specifically on how you pronounce "R" as a standalone letter, rather than as part of a word. This varies by accent. A pirate would say "an Ahrrr PC".

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -730,7 +730,7 @@ General Bitcoin Core
 
 - Make sure pull requests pass CI before merging.
 
-  - *Rationale*: Makes sure that they pass thorough testing, and that the tester will keep passing
+  - *Rationale*: Make sure that they pass thorough testing, and that the tester will keep passing
      on the master branch. Otherwise, all new pull requests will start failing the tests, resulting in
      confusion and mayhem.
comments.body:
this can probably be dropped completely. I'd guess it was written back when CI on open source was an fresh and possibly unknown concept. However, today, it seems common sense to require passing CI for all CI tasks, just like the code is required to compile on all supported build configs (even if they are not tested by CI). But the requirement that code must compile on all supported build configs isn't mentioned here either.

So, I'd say to either remove this (as it is common sense), or reword it to a more general meaning, expanding the meaning beyond CI.
